articles.title: About Me
articles.contents:
I am an educator, researcher, data scientist, and writer. I am currently an Education Data Specialist for Chesterfield County Public Schools, where I use data to help guide decisions and improve students’ educational experiences. In my free time, I enjoy reading, writing, data visualization/analysis, going to the gym, and spending time with friends & family (including my pup, Nala).



I earned my PhD in educational psychology from the VCU School of Education in July 2019, where I worked in the Motivation and Self-Regulation Lab and in the Cognition and Learning Lab to study students’ motivation, behaviors, and achievement. In my dissertation, I studied how writers’ daily emotional states (think: anxiety, enjoyment, boredom) influenced their productivity as well as the day-to-day inertia of these emotional states.
During grad school, I discovered a love for working with data – exploring, visualizing, modeling, and communicating. I mostly work (and blog) in R, but I’m always learning new languages and technologies. Well, as much as I can with a toddler and an infant in the house.
Projects and Publications
If you’re interested in seeing some of the things I’ve worked on, check out my publications page, my visualizations page, or my blog. You can also browse through my Github for things I’m working on that maybe haven’t made it to my website yet.
Consulting and Contracted Work
Time permitting, I occasionally do some consulting and contract work. Although I specialize in educational research, I’m generally proficient with a wide range of statistical modeling frameworks, data visualization, and dashboard design (via {shiny}), among other things. If you’re interested in working with me, send me an email.

articles.title: Publications
articles.contents:
Since I earned by PhD and finished grad school in summer 2019, publishing peer-reviewed research has been less of a priority for me. However, this page contains most of my academic research and other publications.

articles.title: Visualizations
articles.contents:
This page presents a collection of data visualizations I’ve created, mostly for fun/in my free time. All visualizations were created using the R programming language.
Maynard James Keenan Songs

I gathered data through the Spotify API to analyze the length of songs by Maynard James Keenan’s bands.

RVA Pets

Using data from Richmond’s Open Data Portal and Open Street Map, I mapped the location of cats and dogs in RVA.

European Energy Production

Using data from Eurostat, I visualized how each country in Europe produced energy in 2018.

Notable Black Scientists

Using data from Wikipedia, I adopted a minimalist approach to highlight notable Black scientists and inventors throughout the history of the US.

Beach Volleyball

Using data from the #TidyTuesday Project (via BigTime stats), I visualized Kerri Walsh Jennings and Misty May-Treanor’s key match statistics over time.

Beer Production

Using data from the Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau, I created a cartogram showing which states produce the most beer relative to their populations.

White Christmas Lyrics

After pulling lyrics using the {genius} package, I created a network to show connections between words used in the album.

Virginia Early Childhood Care & Education

I used data from the Virginia Quality website and Google’s GeoCoding API to create a Voronoi tesselation of high-quality ECCE sites in Virginia.
21st Century Rap Rankings

Using data from a BBC Music survey on the best hip-hop songs of all time, I analyzed who the most celebrated rappers were each year in the 21st century.

More Visualizations
You can see more visualizations I’ve created in my #TidyTuesday Github repo (here) or in my miscellaneous visualizations repo (here)
